page.title: 07A Roof Over Our Heads
page.content: In{Banchory}there are many styles of homes consisting mainly detatched and semi-detatched two storey buildings with a liberal scattering of bungalow types.Large Victorian era homes are found near the centre of the town.An unusual feature about these older houses is that many of them have a small cottage within their grounds which had probably been the home of the gardener.These dwellings are often now rented out as holiday homes.The more modern architectural types are part of the select estates built to the North,East,and West of the main thoroughfare.Along the high Street we find mostly flats.These have been built above the shops which line our busy main street.
